      • filtersByType

        public static Set<Asset> filtersByType(Set<Asset> assets,
                       AssetType... filters)

        Filters the given set of Assets using the given array of AssetType.

        Parameters:
        assets - The set of Assets to filter.
        filters - Types of asset used to filter.
        Returns:
        a filtered collection of Assets.

      • filtersByName

        public static Set<Asset> filtersByName(Set<Asset> assets,
                       String[] excludedAssetNames)

        Filters the given set of Assets by removing all elements whose name is present in the given array of excluded asset names.

        Parameters:
        assets - The collection of Assets to filter.
        excludedAssetNames - The collection of asset names to exclude from the collection.
        Returns:
        a filtered collection of Assets.

      • filtersByNameAndType

        public static Set<Asset> filtersByNameAndType(Set<Asset> assets,
                              Set<String> excludedAssetNames,
                              AssetType type)

        Filters the given set of Assets by removing all elements whose name is present in the given array of excluded asset names and whose type if given as parameter.

        Parameters:
        assets - The collection of Assets to filter.
        excludedAssetNames - The collection of asset names to exclude from the collection.
        type - The type of asset to exclude.
        Returns:
        a filtered collection of Assets.

      • filtersByDomPosition

        Filters the given set of Assets using the given AssetDomPosition.

        Parameters:
        assets - The set of Assets to filter.
        desiredPosition - The DOM position used to filter.
        Returns:
        a filtered collection of Assets.

      • filtersNotVendor

        public static Set<Asset> filtersNotVendor(Set<Asset> assets)

        Filters the given set of Assets by removing all vendor assets.

        Parameters:
        assets - The set of Assets to filter.
        Returns:
        a filtered collection of Assets.

      • getAssetFinalLocation

      • extractCacheKeyFromRequest

        public static String extractCacheKeyFromRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)

        Extracts the asset cache key from the provided request using the configured DandelionConfig.ASSET_URL_PATTERN.

        For example, using my-pattern as a custom URL pattern and the following request URL:

        /context/my-pattern/7c267aa805f44ef61a273afbe4d26f2a/css/application-1.0.css

        This method will extract 7c267aa805f44ef61a273afbe4d26f2a.

        Parameters:
        request - The HttpServletRequest made against the server to load the asset.
        Returns:
        the cache key present in the request URL.

      • extractRequestKeyFromRequest

        public static String extractRequestKeyFromRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)

      • generateStorageKey

        public static String generateStorageKey(Asset asset,
                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)

        Generates a MD5 hash using information of the provided Asset.

        The set of information used to generate the hash depends on the location key.

        • webapp, jar, webjar, classpath and remote: bundle name + asset name + asset type
        • api: bundle name + asset name + asset type + current URI
        Parameters:
        asset - The asset holding information used to generate the hash.
        Returns:
        a MD5 hash.

      • getAssetLocator

        public static AssetLocator getAssetLocator(Asset asset,
                           Context context)
